etymology.description: pictogram: a bird; compare 鳥 (bird); see also the original version of its variant 於.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a bird and is closely related in form and meaning to 鳥. Association with crows extends the senses to ‘crow’ and ‘black/dark’; early forms also influenced the variant 於.
etymology.simplification: Reduced for stroke economy in the PRC reform: 烏 → 乌 by collapsing the pictorial bird into a simple outline and dropping the bottom four dots, creating a common simplified element used in derivatives.

examples.chinese: 乌鸦在树上叫(烏鴉在樹上叫)。
examples.english: The crow is cawing in the tree.
